author: @bartekwrzesniewski4576
text: Hey, to all the new people (including me) I have found a solution to one of your potential problems! Are you having trouble install packages using "pip" command in cmd for Windows? Use this website https://projects.raspberrypi.org/en/projects/using-pip-on-windows/4 . This website helped me to put my Python and it's scripts in the PATH for my PC to recognize Python properly. The error may be that it says " "pip" is not recognized as internal or external command", this should fix it! If you are getting a message saying that your package has been installed on to a folder "C:\Users\............\Scripts\" or whatever it may be, copy that directory and paste it into the PATH twice, once WITH the "\Script\" and once WITHOUT the "\Script\" at the end. After that, your PC should be able to recognize Python correctly and you should be able to install anything using "pip" command. Hope this helps!
